I'd like to recommend this game, but can't. 

It's far too grindy, the bots are completely worthless, some classes just aren't worth playing, and the matchmaking is terrible. People constantly go AFK and take up a slot so no one else can join, leaving you (at best) in a 3 man team fighting a horde sized for 4. People also like to friendly fire a lot. Having to play on Hard challenge mode to get challenge coins makes this extremely frustrating, as a lot of the "challenges" make the level essentially unbeatable unless you're playing with 4 high leveled people that are very good at the game.

I've gotten fairly far in terms of meta progression, but the barrier to entry on a single match makes me just not care anymore. The length of wait time to get into a match is bad enough, but having to rely on luck to get good teammates just obliterates any chance of me wanting to play anymore. As there's no way to create/search individual lobbies, or stop yourself from matching with a person you know is intentionally friendly firing your whole team, you're subjected to the whims of whatever algorithm this game's search function is running.

One positive thing about the game: The horde mode is pretty cool, and there's not usually wait time for it. Unfortunately, I'm not sure you get any points if you leave early. It's a good way to power level upgrades and regular currency, but most of the more desirable upgrades for guns require blue challenge coins, which you'll have to play the regular challenge modes for.

If the lobby system were fixed so people could actually host a lobby, kick/ban people from joining their lobbies, and search for a list of lobbies, the game would actually be playable. Unfortunately, I can't recommend it in its current state, and I have no reason to believe it will change.

OK

Game is fun, but the amount of bugs makes it impossible to recommend it to anyone else even if you legit like the game, reason why im making this review right now

Whats inside the game?

PvP (2v2 to 4v4)(side game, casual) 
active at noon (2023) quickplay option to find active lobbies, pvp is looking for games option with 0 matchmaker features, 15 min matches at max, different objectives to win (deathmatch, king of the hill, etc), 10 classes to level up to 13, with weapon and equipment from the PvE mode

PvE (4 players or with bots)(main game)
campaign is is the basic mode where you can load any map at any difficulty to learn the map or play the highest difficulty (5) possible
then you have the challenge mode, where you complete daily and weekly tasks for extra currency, (the difficulty is 3 or 4 out of 5) the twist is that challenge maps have mods that add up to 3 extra rules making it a bit harder 99% of the times unless you pick a class that counters or ignore the mods
difficulty 4 isnt that challenging once you know how to play

DOCUMENTS
documents are just one extra collectible to pick up when running challenge mode maps, every 3 successful runs you complete 1 document, once you have 3 documents (9 runs) you completed the docs for that map, documents give you a very small buff at best, most of them are not even 100% chance of procing, they unlock, 1 melee weapon, 1 challenge perk and 1 skin

HORDE AND HORDE XL (endless wave, reminds me a bit of the tower defense genre)
you build defenses, upgrade weapons, complete side quests to earn more resources to keep your defenses and ammo up

CHARACTERS
split in 8 different classes, each one starts with a set tier 1 main weapon, a pistol as secondary, some with a heavy weapon as third an unique equipment, some classes can start with a tier 2 main weapon, some with a tier 2 weapon secondary (1 even with a tier 3), some can add or change the heavy

the customization is possible with thanks to a level system for characters AND weapons too

characters have 30 levels total and you can activate 9 out of 27 perks, perks 0, 10, 20 and 30 are static, you cant swap them
once you reach 30 for the first time a prestige system is unlocked to grind even more levels for that class, allowing you to reset the progress to level 0 to farm more static perks, up to 4 times for now, 1 every 30 levels (in raw numbers level 31, 61, 91 and 121 to get all the prestige perks) every perk unlock cost coins, every prestige reset cost even more coins and you have to buy the basic perks again

WEAPONS
then you have the final and most grindy one, the weapon farm, for the first 4-5 levels weapons do less damage and aggro enemies, weapons get xp per zombie kill + bonus if headshot, it cost coins for each lvl
you can also customize the weapons with up to 3 perks, you have 1 slot restricted to CHALLENGE coins perks which are harder to farm and in fact is the last thing that you will complete along with cosmetics because challenge coins are that scarce, some of the restricted slot are only unlocked with lvl 2 prestige, the other 2 slots can be purchased with normal coins once you reach the required level or finished a specific difficulty 5 map

weapons are split in 3 tiers (some t3 arent even that good) then you have heavy weapons (from a chainsaw to rocket launcher, lost when you run out of ammo) and melee weapons (from quick light to mid to slow heavy, with rechargeable stamina)

SPECIAL ZOMBIES
the game also has special zombies
the hard to kill
the one that spawns more
the one that puts an aoe poison cloud when taking damage/dead unless you kill them with headshots only
the one that jumps from behind and stuns you until you are dead or a teammate saves you
the one that runs at you with a small wave of normal zombies that also can stun you until you are dead or a teammate saves you
the one that just wants to give you a hug before exploding
the one that spits at you a debuff that kills you after a few seconds if dont have 3 seconds to clear it (basically 3 secs self stunned) everyone with a sound cue to make it fair

theres not much else to say in a basic review, so if u can handle its buggy code this game might be for you, worth about 500+ hours to get everything at max level without perks and cosmetics

Good game but some problems with the repetitiveness, I know what the devs are trying to do here at it is done well. But with the 1 1/2 minute wait times in between the horde modes total length of being almost like 1h+ for full completion the pacing is  slow as hell. But still cool to kill Zs by blowing their limbs and bodies off. The missions are cool but again if you are soloing this with matchmaker you sometimes can have actual monkeys who are on playstation hitting the bong while blasting generic rap while screaming at their pregnant girlfriends while also trying to cordinate a 5 level difficulty mission. Also some missions are actually impossible to solo I believe, with the LFD2 vibe of a zombie grabbing you and killing you only works with people but if you are solo I cant see you completing the levels so what is the point of even private play? The bots are also useless aimbot scripts that are very un fleshed out so they will just sit there in a line of 3 while either following you or just sitting there at the pre scripted shoot zone. The skins and gun skins are cool but I do think more should be here even for what the devs have made more needs to be added for more reasons to play. 

Also for horde mode just a lil tip, if you are using a non explosive class and solo dont try to hold forward you have to make setups and defenses in the back, again I dont think its possible to solo with some classes even with bots too...

Ill keep playing this game though but this game is not very PC friendly and the players dont really take this shit seriously and will sometimes do random autistic shit since the game is literally holding back while blasting Zs that cant really kill you so the skill curb will be hit 2 hours in tbh.

Intense and fast-paced action: The game offers an intense and fast-paced action experience where players need to fight off hordes of zombies. The gameplay is designed to keep players on their toes and engaged throughout the game.

Variety of weapons and classes: World War Z offers a wide range of weapons and classes to choose from, allowing players to customize their loadouts according to their playstyle. Each class has unique abilities and skills, adding an element of strategy to the game.

Co-op gameplay: The game is designed for cooperative play, where players can team up with their friends or join matches online to take on the zombie hordes. The co-op gameplay offers a social element that adds to the overall enjoyment of the game.

Challenging difficulty: World War Z is known for its challenging difficulty, forcing players to use their skills and teamwork to survive the zombie onslaught. The game offers a satisfying experience when players overcome difficult challenges.

Immersive world: The game is set in a post-apocalyptic world, with various locations and environments, adding to the immersive experience. The attention to detail in the game's design and graphics is impressive and adds to the overall gameplay experience.

Regular updates: The developers have been releasing regular updates and content for the game since its release, which shows their commitment to improving the game and keeping it fresh for players.

Overall, World War Z is a good TPP zombie shooter game that offers an engaging gameplay experience with its intense action, variety of weapons and classes, co-op gameplay, challenging difficulty, immersive world, and regular updates.

My opinion on the game:

The Good:
It looks and feels a lot like an improved third person version of Left 4 Dead franchise but it's definitely a much better game over L4D with better graphics, horde mechanics, classes, perks, environment, turret placing, barbwire, electroshock, barricades, freezing system, attatchments, various pvp and co-op modes, it has both Third Person and First Person, the list goes on.

The Bad:
PVP mode is fun but dead due to cheaters. Not needed anyway, the game shines for the Co-op PVE part and L4D nostalgia which is the most important thing imo.

I was afraid it would just feel like a bad version or knock-off of Left 4 Dead 2 but its not. While there certainly are similarities it feels like a completely different game. Love the progression upgrades for classes and guns. Some classes are clearly inferior and probably need some buffs but otherwise great game.

GOOD:
- Decent weapons and nice design
- nice zombie behavior
- Very nice character design

WHY BAD REVIEW?:
- Campaign way too short!
- Class are a joke... could be so much better
- Upgraded L4D Copy... it could have been a bit less obvious and more creative, this kind of action should be seen in survival games in the like of 7 Days to Die.
- Way too expensive for what is worth really! 22$ in sales is too expensive! doesn't worth more than 15$
- You cannot start with whatever weapon you want! sometime i have to play a whole game to get the weapon at the end what a terrible thing!...

6/10 SPOILERS AHEAD! I must say this : for l4d2 wanna be clone, this one is pretty good. A lot of characters,maps, weapons, AND HORDES OF ZOMBIES! Characters are well written, but unlike with Left 4 dead 2 you just play with them like 3 missions then it switches to another 4 survivors... So i dont even feel sad if they die in the gameplay... Our story begins in New York - we can play as a Gangster (Named angel - Male), a Firefighter (named Tashaun - male), a Hacker (named Bunko - female) and someone called Arnetta - female. They are trying to get out of the city - they all manage that by finding the army that is evacuating civilians. Next is Jerusalem. This time the 4 survivors are from the Army and bloody hell by far my favourie survivors. that being Judd - male, Dina - female, Ethan - male (my favourite survivor, because he wears a juggernaut suit) and Daniel - male. Their quest is to find a doctor, who can activate a fokin Nuclear bomb. Its not explained how he got to Jerusalem or how he can activate it...WUT?! However they manage it and an army of zombies is done for. Then it cuts to Moscow (obvously it is Russia). We play as Oksana - female, Ivan - male, Timur - male and doesnt sound like a russian... Last is Sergei who is a preacher. But this is where the game kinna gets stupid - first we rescue a chopper that has food suplies, i though in the second mission we deliver the suplies, but nope! we go to a goddamn shop to brodcast a message... after that we go release a super weapon created by the soviets... Neuron gas that kills zombies... And one thing - none of the characters say Blyat... (that is a joke, dont take it seriously). Then another 4 survivors and another campaign. This time Tokyo in Japan. We play as Sho- male, Kimiko - female and a verry good sniper, Tatsuo - male and looks like a ex soldier, Hiroji - male and has wakizashi. These guys are helping to evacuate civis from Tokyo onto a big ship. They manage to do that, but what made me confused that some zombies managed to get on board... Not even explained... However it isnt the end... Apperantly they had a deal with russians in Kamchatka. FOR SOME WEIRD REASON THOSE RUSSIANS OPPENED FIRE ON THEM AND AFTER THAT THEY SAY WE HAD NO DEAL, BECAUSE THEY LOST COMMUNICATION! SO DID THE JAPANESE LIED ABOUT THE DEAL OR THE RUSSIANS ARE LYING JUST TO SAVE THEIR ASSES?! This part is horribly explained and i hate it.... Next is Marseille in France - we play as Eloise - female and sometimes sounds like a biatch, Raoul - male, Marine - female with tomboy hair and is a soldier, Karim. They are trying to turn on the rocket system, so they can fight against the zombies, after that they defend a fort. Next campaign is in Rome (obviously in Italy). These guys are trying to set up A MASSIVE sound trap to kill zombies in Rome and damn that is pretty nice campaign. We can play as Daniela - female and a motorbike champion with a bat, Giovanni - male and a good hunter and fisherman and leads the team, Sofia - female who has phd - engineer, then Marco - male who lost his wife 20 months after the break and what keeps him alive is the love for his team. That is all. Ofcourse the characters have info about them in the menu, but exept Marseille and Rome characters everyone has a video about them... Makes me sad. Now lets talk about the zombies. Even on normal they can kick your ass. I mean litteraly. I got ganged  by 4 zombies and within 20 seconds i got downed. But ofcourse the game aslo has special zombies - Lurker - practicly Hunter wanna be who doesnt scream, but quietly wheezes and he usually wait behind a corner to jump on ya and beat ya up, Next is bull - charger wanna be, but this one turns when he charges, he has no defence on his back so shoot him there. Next is infector - this one spits infection on ya and if ya dont disinfect within like 10 seconds you will turn into a zombie instantly, to kill him easily you must shoot him to head then finish him off with a melee strike. Next is a screamer - he screams, more zombies appear, simple. Booster - makes zombies run faster. Gasbag - zombie with a hazard suit that if he dies makes a cloud of poison. Bomber - he gets to ya = explodes, but if ya manage to shoot him to his legs, then finish him off with a melee strike, you will get a bonus that if ya carrie to the end = you get bonus points depending on the difficulty and also a weapon. Speaking of weapons you can carry 3 weapons and your tool depending on class (about them later). Many weapons are in the game and you can upgraid them when you win missions you can upgraid them, what i do love that the silencers accualy dont atract zombies and if ya shoot with the loud weapon, more zombies spawn and makes screamer appear more. You have primary, secondary, heavy weapons and melee weapons that can be knifes, swords, axes - take your picks. Also weapons have skins... most of them are normal, but some of them look like shit. heavy weapons cant be upgraided, because they are strongest weapons in the game and they are the weapons that you NEED for the hordes or you are good as dead. When defending against a horde you also get defences - that being barbed wire, electicity, fance, mortar, auto turret and 50 mm cannon. Hordes are repetetive as hell, but hey i do like killing zombies. Now those classes. You can upgraid them as well and there is quite many of them. that being Gunslinger - expert on guns and has a granade, Medic - starts with a medikit and has a gun that gives temporary health, Fixer - increases ammo and has a supply bag, Hellraiser - expert with explosives and can have c4 or claymores, Dronemaster - obviously has a drone, Slasher - expert with melee and has a stun gun, Exterminator - focuses on dealing with hordes and has a molotov, Vanguard - has a shield and can charge with it. Also there are Multiplayer classes , but multiplayer is dead in the water. Also like in l4d2 we have a horde mode aka survival. Next we have challanges - campaign maps that have some mutators. Difficulty - Easy, normal, hard - play only on these,because the rest is unfair to play. that is all. 6/10 because the story is sometimes stupid or doesnt make sence, difficulty above hard is unfair and bot are stupid too. However besides all of that I enjoyed this game a lot.

PROS:
It has weapon upgrades and customization. You can level up your weapon and put skin and perks on it.

+ There is a character classes, such as Medic class that excel in healing, Gunslinger that excel at reloading and weapon damage, Hellraiser that specialized in explosives, or a Slasher that excel in melee weapons, etc. You can select perks and play as you wish.

+ The number of zombies is really large, which is both challenging and satisfying.

+ Various random daily challenges

CONS:
- It has a random matchmaking system, and sometimes it will take so long to find players to play with us. And honestly, it's better to have a lobby system with a room list where you can search, create, lock, and join the rooms.

- This game's save data is saved locally, so people can have 100% game progression by changing their save data. This broke down the entire progression system.

- There is no vote-kick system, so you're doomed if you meet a troll player.


CONCLUSION:
Overall, World War Z Aftermath is still an enjoyable game worth playing.

[h1] PREFACE [/h1]
This review is neither positive, nor negative. I will try to be as objective about this as possible.

[h1] Story telling [/h1]

It has some story, but there's minimal emphasis on it. Do not buy the game if you're expecting a good story.

[h1] NPC's [/h1]

[b] Friendly NPC's [/b] are only capable to protect you from small numbers of zombies. They can't use or carry utilities such as: crowd-control (heavy) weapons, class-specific items (grenades, drones, molotovs, etc.), medkits. They can't interact with buttons or set a breach-charge to open a door. There is no way to give them orders.
Friendly NPC's, just like in many games, are designed to be weak. Please, ask friends or find people to play with for better experience.

[b] Enemy NPC's [/b], aka zombies, consist mainly of regular zombies + some special zombies. I will not discuss their specifics, there is youtube and google for it.
Zombies show little threat on their own, but can easily overwhelm with big numbers. Crowd-control is key. Find counter-actions against special zombies to defeat them efficiently.

[h1] Gunplay [/h1]

Gunplay is okay, nothing exciting nor bad about it. But there is something to know: As of 30.03.2023 (dd/mm/yy), there is a bug related to guns. In first-person, if you interact with items (picking-up explosive ammo on the ground), your gun might glitch and it will not shoot. You will have to ADS (which doesn't exist lol, it's just a minizoom)  to make it shoot. Or spam the hell out of it until it works. Better use third-person until the bug is addressed.

Gun and class progression systems are okay, although I find them to be boring, I will explain why in [i] Gameplay [/i]

[h1] Gameplay [/h1]

During your first playthrough, I suggest playing it solo with bots or with friends. Do not go CO-OP.
Then it's only recommended to continue with friends. People in CO-OP do not communicate at all. Hence, minimal teamplay. Also, it's always better to play with friends for sh*ts and giggles :-)
Consider CO-OP only if other options are not available.

Oh, this game has "Multiplayer"? Yeah, about that... It's basically Human vs Human match. It's bad and no one really plays it. And neither should you.

[h1] Updates [/h1]

So far, they haven't forgotten about the game. They recently added a new mode (Horde XL) and a new weapons-progression system. Although I can't say that updates are frequent.

[h1] Final thoughts [/h1]

I suggest buying this game only if you have friends who will play it with you. Otherwise, keep scrolling.

Comment section is open by the way. If you want to correct me or add your opinion on the subject, you're welcome.

It is a blast for any seasoned zombie slayer. The maps are wickedly designed, and let me tell you, when you crank up the difficulty, you better have your squad ready for some top-notch teamwork.[h1] [/h1]The character build system is a playground for customization, allowing you to fine-tune your zombie-killing machine to your heart's content. And for those of you who love a good grind, the game's got you covered with some sweet collectibles and challenges.[h1] [/h1]Oh, and when you finally get your hands on some upgraded weapons and builds, it's like becoming a zombie apocalypse superhero. I spent a solid 70 hours immersed in the game, and it wasn't until the end that the endless mode maps started feeling a bit stale ‚Äì but hey, that's a lot of bang for your buck.[h1] [/h1]Out of all the co-op zombie shooters out there, World War Z: Aftermath stands tall as one of the finest. So, gather your crew, gear up, and get ready to mow down hordes of undead in style!

Fun game to shoot zombies mindlessly, but multiplayer is pretty much dead. 
Majority of features are not well-designed, only extending gameplay through repetitive RNG and encouragement of grinding through a prestige system. 

Update (Apr 2022, Cut and Mend Patch): After more than 500 hours of gameplay, this game has so much potential to be better, but it seems that the developers have shelved this to work on other projects, with the last update in April 2022.

Some perks are worthless (or near worthless) due to poor game design - There's a perk that allows you to recover when pinned by infected. Unfortunately, the recovery animation does not include invulnerability, and you will take damage as your character stands up while infected crowd around you. On higher difficulties, this can cost your entire health bar, and you get downed anyway.

Minor bugs and glitches such as infected swarms dealing damage to you even when you are out of the visual zone, or game-breaking bugs such as special infected clipping you through environment into an area where other players are unable to revive you from.

As a player who enjoys solo play, the AI bots are frustrating to work with, as they either get in your way of your line of fire at the worst possible time, or they are blind to the obvious dangers that downed you in the first place. Examples I can think of are:

1. AI tries to rescue downed teammate, walking through a swarm instead of taking a safer route, getting downed, and the next bot repeats the same failed strategy till all bots are down. 
2. AI walks instead of runs to revive teammates, which is painful to watch especially if the downed player(s) are a distance away. Usually that player dies before the bot reaches them, even in situations where there is minimal infected threat.
3. AI tries to revive you after you have been downed by a lurker around the corner. Instead of taking out the lurker, the bot will make a beeline for you, blind to the lurker just squatting there, and gets downed. Repeat till all bots are down.
4. AI stands at fixed locations during swarm attacks, especially in the line of FIXED machine gun placements.
5. AI does not prioritize special infected targets such as bombers and focuses on normal infected around them. This leads to the bomber dealing massive damage to all of them, as the bots tend to stick close to each other.

AI can and should have been designed better. They seemed to have been designed poorly on purpose, which is even more puzzling. Bots are perpetually stuck at level 1, cannot upgrade or modify their weapons, or pick up, or use items. Even bots in l4d2, a game that came out in 2009, could pick up health packs and try to heal you. Players should be able to give bots simple commands, such as stand and guard a specific location, or pick up/use/give items. Instead, bots crowd as a group, and follow very obvious preplanned paths, which makes for a robotic and lifeless feel. Bots can be helpful on lower difficulties, but on higher difficulties they are obviously a handicap.

Once you've played enough, players should have an understanding of "the meta" - how to exploit certain safe zones or manipulate the infected system to clear higher difficulties. Personally, it does not feel as rewarding as if I had cleared it "the proper way", as it feels less organic and more of taking advantages of loopholes in the game.

I want to love this game as the unique swarm mechanics, graphics, and weapon mods/customization options are a step up compared to l4d2. It seems like the developers were on their way to create such a good game, but then they decided to just stop and not take the last step to polish it slightly. It feels like such a wasted opportunity. 

7/10.

Update (Jan 2023, XL Horde Mode): The developers have given bots a way to pick up ONLY health packs (excluding bandage kits and adrenaline), and use it on themselves or pass it to players when pinged. This is an improvement, but it remains janky as the bots do not respond quickly to it and require multiple pings to pick up nearby health packs. As of this change, bots are now health pack mules at best, which is a small improvement.

The XL Horde Mode update is a lot of fun if you enjoy just blowing up massive waves of zombies. In addition, they revamped the weapon skill system to include perks and other changes. These are nice changes, but it isn't very user friendly, as when your weapon levels up, excess experience points are wasted until you unlock the next level (which uses in-game credits). 

6/2/23: A quick fix was issued to fix the silenced weapons breaking stealth, and all weapons have been returned to having a silenced variant. As it stands, the current underlying negativity could have been avoided with some basic user testing. While the developers fixed it within a week, it seemed only due to the strong backlash from the players. The optics that they present to its player base displays a lack of care and respect, which in turn is reciprocated by its players. 

7.5/10

As I do normally, I started off checking the options. When I saw the "User Data and Privacy Collection - ON" I switched that OFF immediately. What did I get in response? If I turn off their ability to collect User Data, I am no longer allowed to play online. So I'm stuck playing the game with their handicapped AI companions. Freaking wonderful. So if you want to be able to play the game as it was intended, you are forced to allow them to collect user data. I'm sorry, but this is absolute BS. I am purchasing a game from you, I'm not getting married to you. Stop demanding I give you my data in order to use the products I purchased. It is to a point that these companies need to allow us to collect their data if they can collect ours. Maybe then they will keep to themselves and we can have a nice and orderly transaction.

only worth the purchase on sale. Grinding for weapon upgrades is a slog because the devs introduced new mechanics to slow your progression down. Upgrading a weapon's level costs up to 4 or 5 missions on the highest difficulty worth of coins. Higher tier weapon perks like damage upgrades or +magazine size may require up to 3 complete documents, which can only be found while playing challenges. Most weapon perks are useless or too situational eg missing health to be useful. Weapon perk tree needs a complete overhaul. Plenty of people play on modded save files, so although they are max level, they still play terribly. 

TLDR Dev's don't know how to address player attrition so they put up lots of barriers to player progression and try to get you addicted to daily quests to promote longevity. Core game still fun but 'perks' and 'bonuses' do nothing but aggravate players. 'Cheaters' are everywhere

This game is a "no" for me, dog.  I want to like this game.  I really do.  It is a fun game and with a few tweaks, it could be a classic.  The problem is in the core mechanics.  The special Infected semi-mirror Left 4 Dead and they require "teamwork" which wouldn't be a problem except the friendly AI are as useless as porn to a eununch.  They can fire their gun.  Not accurately either (try the Crossbow Fiesta mutator and see how bad they really are).  And that's pretty much all they can do as of the time of this review.  Need to be saved from a Lurker (L4D Hunter)?  Nah, they might get there but it will be 30 seconds too late if they do.  Grabbed by a Bull (L4D Charger)?  Forget it, you're gonna be pounded into ground monkey meat.  Get Infected and need cover while you heal/recover?  Nope, and not only nope but the 3 bots will die in seconds of you going down.  So if you're more of a solo gamer or can't convince 3 friends to buy this or can't kidnap 3 other people and force them to play, you're up crap creak without even so much as shoes.  I'm not saying I want bots to carry players, I'm saying I want them to have basic skills like "protect the only player who matters" and "defend the NPC who's death means game over" or "carry this medkit for me."  Basic stuff like that.

Next point, The Grind: The "best" versions of the weapons in this game are locked behind a grind that makes World of Warcraft is jealous and without 4 at least competent players, you're in for twice the grind because the only way to earn challenge coins is to grind and with the AI having a spoon lodged in their frontal lobes, you need to use mutators to make winning possible.  After you play the campaign, it's just not fun to keep playing the same levels over and over to earn 1000 challenge coins (you can get 5 at a time with mutators).  

Bottom line is: friendly AI is brain dead so bring friends and there isn't enough content to merit the amount of grinding it takes to unlock everything so don't be a completionist.

I'm a big fan of zombie games, where I've played Left 4 Dead 1 and 2 with friends in computer shops, Dead Island on both console and PC, Dying Light, Resident Evil, the list goes on. So when WWZ came along, it was a welcome game to play on coop, especially when the pandemic came soon after.

Now, I loved the movie, the book, and the game when it came out in 2019, it was awesome. But the recent changes have been so disappointing. It feels like the devs are not even trying, or they had an intern craft up the new weapon progression system. Now, I didn't have difficulty wrapping my head around the changes, but the changes were not carefully planned out.

The cosmetic skins of the weapons, that's fine, I don't have much issue with it as the stats and perks of your choice are added to the weapon. What really bothered me was how grindy the whole process was going to be in leveling each weapon, because obviously enough, you can play favorites, but how often does your favorite gun come out? You now have to grind out 15 levels or so for the weapons, which is very tedious and time consuming.

The perks are hit or miss, some are really good, and some just plain suck. But the kicker here is that they tied a portion of the perks to the silly document hunting system they introduced some time in 2022 or earlier. Imagine having to play the same level 9 times, along with mutators that might or might not be in your favor. I did this for the "Advanced Combat Weapon" before the update, and while we did achieve a stage with all 9 documents, the achievement was short-lived, because the devs locked the most important part of the perk weapon to collecting every document for an entire episode. Sorry, but not all of us want to search every nook and cranny in a level to find 1 document, and repeat the entire thing again hoping that you'll complete the stage without incident.

Looking at the horde XL update, it isn't that big an achievement in all honesty. First off, it's mandatory to own the aftermath DLC to access horde XL - but before the update, you could actually invite friends that only had the base game, from different platforms to join you in the aftermath DLC stages. That was really good, but it does not apply to horde XL. Speaking of these changes, they have yet to address the framerate issues, the lag and freezing on devices that aren't next gen, like the PS5 and what have you. This actually occurs when you're just playing the normal story stages, which totally ruins the gameplay for all of us, especially where the game continues to run and your character just dies by the time the lag or the framerate goes back to normal.

The devs could have added more stages (seriously it's called WORLD War Z for a reason) yet we're stuck with New York, Jerusalem, Moscow, Tokyo, Marseille, Rome, and Kamchatka. I'll throw in South Korea because they made it clear that the normal horde mode takes place there. But no other countries have been added yet? After the game has been out this long?

And they still haven't added the 3rd row skills for our classes. It's rather obvious that with the space left for it, there should have been a 3rd row of new skills, but the devs have not sorted that out yet.

So would I recommend this game to anyone else? No, I'd wait until the devs have sorted out the performance issues of the game at the very least.

So...they listened?

I'm as surprised as the rest of you.

They more or less fixed ALL of the issues that I had with the game, save for a few new ones cropping up that really aren't as bad.

It would be nice if FPS mode was more fleshed out, if the attachments for the guns and such actually meant they handled differently, ect, but it's better than it was before and that's a good start.

The fact that weapons no longer can be "Paid for" via skins or the deluxe edition to skip all of the progression. There's actually progression to be HAD now, though I figure most people playing have already capped out their guns, it's still nice to see them having some customization and the skins being JUST skins.

The performance is a bit better than before too, and the new XL map gives some much needed variety to the grind.

If they can keep this up, maybe tweak movement a little bit to be a little tighter and less floaty, and keep pumping out some maps, I'd pay full price for it. As it stands, I'd still wait for a sale, but at least you're not skipping straight to endgame with the deluxe edition anymore and that's nice.

Because earning your powerups feels better in the long run, and that alone changes me from a "Nah" to a "If you like zombie games, sure!"

The game's graphics are stunning and the post-apocalyptic setting is incredibly atmospheric. The zombies are terrifying and unrelenting, and the game does a great job of capturing the feeling of being overrun by hordes of the undead. Gameplay is fast-paced and action-packed, with plenty of weapons and upgrades to keep things interesting.

The game features a variety of different game modes, including a story-driven campaign, a survival mode, and a mode called "Horde" where players must survive waves of zombies. Each mode offers a unique challenge, and it's great fun to play with friends and try to survive as long as possible. There are now 2 horde maps!

One of the best things about World War Z: Aftermath is the camaraderie it fosters. Playing with friends is a blast, and there's a real sense of accomplishment when you all work together to survive. The game also offers great replay value, with new challenges and modes being added regularly.

Ignore my low playtime here, I have been playing on and off since it's initial launch as an Epic store exclusive and was excited to finally be able drop it and move back to Steam.

The new weapon upgrade system is fucking awful. It wasn't great to begin with but it was infinitely more preferable than what we got now.

[strike]Ignoring the fact there is no in game way to see how much experience a weapon has mid mission, all level progression stops when a weapon levels up and you have to wait until you're back in the lobby to "unlock" the next level and continue progressing. Any experience you thought you were making is lost just to needlessly pad out the grind.[/strike] There is no way to preview any of the new perks so you now have no idea what weapons are worth upgrading or what they even do when they get there.

And the new hoard map is a mixed bag. While it's nice we finally have a new survival map that's a little more involved it feels needlessly complicated. There is no clear way to know where the zombies are coming from, or what route they'll take, or what the new traps do or even what areas are in bounds until you play it once, and even then it's confusing and easy to forget when you have dozens of zombies bearing down on you from every single direction.

As nice as free updates are this one aint it, chief.

So apparently some of my information was entirely wrong, and I feel kind of bad for not doing my due diligence and leaving a review while emotionally compromised. There is a way to see experience for a your current weapon, but it is tucked away and easy to miss if you don't know its there (In the in-game scoreboard at the bottom right). Also, needing to unlock new levels was actually how it worked before and there are others that claim that you can now level up multiple times in one run. Unfortunately, the one game I played to test these new features ended with me being hit with a glitch that did stop my weapon progression, which combined from my long absence from the game led me to believe this was the new system.

I apologise for my mistake. However, my stance on the game still stands and anything I haven't struck through I feel is still perfectly valid, along with a few new criticisms, even if they are more minor. Customizing your weapon now feels entirely pointless since it is purely visual. A few guns seem to be nerfed with the removal of the silencer upgrade seemingly chosen arbitrarily, and others buffed for the same reason. Popular long standing weapon grinding spots seem to have also been nerfed in response to the leveling buff. All in all it seems like a mostly solid win but the increased grind makes it hard to recommend to anyone not interested in the grind, or have no one to grind with.

Too much repetitive grinding. 
After XL update, in challeng mode, if "undying" happens, all special zombies respawn get to have 2x hp (stacking) after they previous death. 8 clips Sniper rifle headshots (with Scope ON) still couldn't kill a Lurker, at the same time you may be chased by 2 Bulls with each more than 50 times normal HP.
I don't think most players can complete the challenge unless using cheats.
Maybe it's because I am not skillful or smart enough, if not then the game deveopers are brain dead.

I really enjoy this game. I play with my wife a lot. At first it was ok cause it was a third person shooter. But making it an FPS was a real game changer. I'd go as far as saying this is probably the best co-op zombie slaying experience on the market right now.

 It has everything L4D had and more. There's a bunch of classes to choose from. All catered to a playstyle, like melee, sharpshooting, tanking, etc... They all go up to level 30 and then you can prestige. Doing that multiple times unlocks all kinds of extra skills. If that wasn;t enough there's at least a solid thirty weapons, all of which can be leveled up to increase their power. You'll find them randomly spawned throughout the maps.

 The campaign seems long enough. I've logged 32 hours and I only beat three of the sevenish campaigns. All the spawns for weapons and some objectives are pretty random which helps keeps things from getting too stale.  They are pretty detailed and I don't ever feel like I stay anywhere for too long. I've been through new york, egypt and russia. Currently working on Japan now. It's safe to say there's a lot of variety in the settings. Plus there's also two horde modes as well. The newest one being Horde XL and just spawns an insane amount of enemies.

In the end, you need to just buy this damn game. It's not perfect and it has quirks like any other but you'll have a blast playing it. The progression systems do well enough to make you want to grind a bit more for that next skill or weapon upgrade. Plus co-op and it's cross platform so you can play with your gay friends on consoles.
Great game to play with friends and mow down loads of zombie hoards!

I genuinely do not see what is positive about this game other than having an "exit game" option.

Zombies clip through walls, they vanish and reappear, and they have pointless game "mechanics".
The co-op campaign is a very boring story line by going through a linear path which is pre-solved by a marker telling you exactly where to go and what to do. The linear game play is only playable when there is a horde of zombies, but that only last a few seconds. 

There are "classes", but the only real thing which separates these classes would be what weapon you start with. Other than that, it is just a reskin of "abilities" which are so mediocre, they wouldn't make a difference. 
The weapon perks are hard to obtain in the co-op campaign and once you have them, they just reset in the next campaign mission.

They also had some very pointless limitations in their "horde" mode. Why must you purchase random weapons rather than the one you specifically enjoy/like. What would the purpose of this be?
You can only place barricades and sentries in pre-designated positions rather than freely building.
They had random placed "creepers", which is essentially the hunter in L4D2, in certain places for no reason.

I could go much further into it, but this game has already wasted my time enough as it is.

Decent game. I got this game on sale over Christmas. Worth the sale price. Then they updated it to make it 10 times more grindy and 5 times more broken. A bad game is one thing, I can return it. Taking a good game and turning it into a bad game, that is a real scumbag move. Let this be a lesson to everyone not to trust Saber Interactive Inc. No one should support any product they put out. They could decide to ruin it some day to make it more pay to play.

What did they do? 

Instead of starting with silenced weapons or being able to unlock them after a few hours of play, you now need to put in dozens of hours with each weapon to unlock. Some weapons that did have them don't have them at all now. In this game zombies are attracted by sound so this is a huge gameplay change. Teammates will get pissed if you're constantly making noise. 

They also separated skills from skins. What does this mean? You can have a gun that looks fully upgraded with a silencer that has no silencer or stat improvements. At the same time you can have a plain looking gun fully stat boosted and silenced. Super confusing, dumb change.

It's kind of impressive that they could completely ruin this game for anyone who doesn't have 1000 hours already in it with just a few changes. DON'T BUY SABER INTERACTIVE INC PRODUCTS!

I played the shit out of this on playstation, pre ordered it, and was addicted for so long.

I maxed every class in it, upgraded all my guns, loved it so much that when my ps4 had issues working, I bought it on steam, then it went dead in the water for a long time.

I uninstalled it assuming it was abandoned, then the XL update came out, was excited to see the big changes they mentioned and I honestly hated all of them.
the new leveling system feels more like a punishment, you level it up enough to earn a perk, that you then have to grind even more for, for the proper challenge credits to even use them.

If I worked on leveling a weapon, just let me pick a perk, or use the standard currency, the weekly and daily's aren't fun enough to sit and grind over and over for a single perk for 1 gun.

If you don't mind grinding fests, and have friends this can be a good game for you, but as for me, I think its time I moved on.

Bottom line: If you're looking for a wave-based co-op (or solo) zombie shooter to preoccupy you for a week or two tops, then this is a decent peep and has potential if the dev's inject some more attention.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Got this game at discount, during the Holidays. 
Its basically a third person horde shooter. Little strategy to it. The maps are long. To clear a map could take you 15 minutes, sometimes close to 30. And there are more than 15 maps. 
If you get this, do it like i did. You want something fun, and sort of like shooting fish in a barrel. 
The graphics are slick. 
The visual representation of the hordes are really cool. 
The cities and scenarios are well composed, and the chromatic gamma chosen... very nice for the game. 
On the plus side, you got perks to achieve, and upgrades on weapons to unlock. 
And 4 difficulty settings. 
I am having fun at the easiest. 

Onto the bad side, i can see how it could get repetitive fast. 
I am a casual gamer, and put 30 minutes a day into the game, so i am able to get a bit out of it. 
But at this point the multiplayer is almost dead. 
Servers are pretty much empty, and also there's no way to kick people out of a match.
So if there's only 1 person ruining a match, you can shut down the game, because that's the only match you will find.
Really really fun i would recommend 10/10

[h1]WWZ: Pretty fun zombie shooter game!¬†[/h1]


I've been keeping an eye out for WWZ for quite a while ever since it was announced and to my utter disappointment, it had to launch on that Epic Games Store as an exclusive for many months, surely a year. So that shutdown any interest I had with WWZ but then, once it released on Steam... d@mn its price was high.

As for the game, it is quite a fun game! Played solo mostly and the last episode, I had to play with players since the teammates A.I. were somehow broken and kept getting killed by zombies, without doing any actions whatsoever. So after restarting that same chapter 4 times, playing with players helped a lot!

I would say overall, the teammates A.I. are serviceable and works decently but for EPISODE 7, that is another story. It is much better than Aliens Fireteam Elite since their teammates A.I. are utterly dumb and useless. AFE REQUIRES you to play with real players so no wonder that game will die out faster than WWZ.

The many locations of this game is quite cool. The visuals are pretty impressive, animations, level designs, sounds, music and especially gameplay, all good! I did not experience any crash or bugs on my playthrough.

My irritants for WWZ would be the slow progression of weapons and class unlocks, requiring you to keep playing in order to unlock more good stuff... especially the starting weapons. What could mitigated on an eventual sequel (if there is any planned) would be to have more variety in missions. They mostly all consist on either escorting VIP's to either repair/unlock areas for power or babysitting NPC's. 


[h1]POSITIVES:[/h1]
[b]+Visuals are pretty great!
+Gameplay is fun. Mowing down zombies with all the firepower at your disposition is quite satisfying!
+Maps variety from the 7 episodes, divided by 3 to 4 chapters for each.
+Zombie variety akin to Left 4 Dead... but no Witch at least!
+No technical issues, bugs or crashed experienced in my playthough (unless you consider poor A.I. for a specific chapter!).
+Perfect UltraWide Monitor support.[/b]


[h1]NEGATIVES:[/h1]
[b]-EPIC GAMES STORE EXCLUSIVE for way too long.
-STEEP PRICE for its Steam launch.
-Slow progression system to unlock weapons and class perks. I'd recommend focusing on one main weapon and class.
-Episode 7, chapter 2: Playing that chapter with teammates A.I. got frustrating since some teammates were kind of frozen, not doing anything... which made me fail the mission four times. [/b]


[h1]RECOMMENDATION:[/h1]
[b]Overall, I do recommend this game... BUT AT SALE ONLY. 
It's fun for sure but I'm pretty sure that fun won't last long. You could solo almost all of the game so you can have decent fun there but I do know WWZ and its same kind of game are designed to be played with players. Keep that in mind later if the game doesn't have any players online.

Until then, if Saber Interactive Inc. do release an additional episode, an expansion or make a sequel, I'd be sure to keep that on my radar! It better not be another EGS exclusive though![/b]

Its fun!Learning to reduce friendly fire can take a bit of getting use to.Good level design.12 missions in total that go pretty quick.a couple days if your into it.The replay value is there for leveling different classes.But if your running harder difficulties its kind of hit or miss in public matchmaking for the right kind of team or a good team.The leveling system could use some better detailing in my opinion.I wish this game had Killing floor 2's classes, in a way the tree is similar.13 useable skills out of 27 to pick from for any of the 6 classes.4 are not optional.Some being passive or chance abilities. Like kill 15 zeeks get 25% chance for equipment fill.Some classes have the same abilities.Its OKAY but feels a bit dry with what could have been done but isnt horrible.The defending a spot against hordes is where the fun and uniqueness of this game shine.Harder difficulties make communication a must for these parts of the game.Just willy nilly whatever wont cut it you need seal team 6 tactics! The weapon upgrades/leveling are cool and refreshing in a elder scrolls sense of the more you use that weapon the more you level its ability and these are found randomly usually in sequence to the stages of the game your in.More likely to find tier3 weapons later in a level.I find myself replaying levels many times over and not getting board with it.Id say a good 8 for this zombie co-op shooter. Valve eat your heart out!

i have played the base game on ps4 for hundreds of hours. the campaign is good and there is a decent variety in locations, classes, weapons and characters. i almost never played pvp, what made this game awesome was the coop campaign so i decided to buy the game also on steam and played the aftermath expansion. i used to love the game base mechanic of levels with overwhelming hordes of zekes to deal with, but the recent updates to the game are making me want to definitely stop playing, especially when used to play at higher difficulties. in particular, freezing cold and rats are not fun to deal with and you AI team is still ground level (and this hurts cause it's getting harder and harder to play with anyone in coop). horde mode can be fun but even though the game has implemented crossplay the playerbase is still very small today, and playing on your own is not as fun. at the moment of this review i sincerely cannot recommend this game

So, while the game is slightly amusing it's obviously a cash grab. Is it worth the initial price, yeah. 
Is it worth all the bullshit cash shop items in game and micro transactions, no. 
Since it's just an attempt to screw people over wallet wise, I can't recommend it.

The game IS fun as hell, and could have been MUCH better if the devs opened up the source for the community to build campaigns etc (like L4D2 etc etc). But they failed.

The game is good for one full walk through, then it's nothing but redundant. Boring.

WHAT I LIKE:
1. big amount of weapons and well done customization
2. multiple character classes "medic, slasher, executioner...", you can edit class specialities
3. when you play online public, anybody can just come and bot player will be replaced by him immediately
4. plenty of special zombies, every one should be killed different way
5. deployable bandage kits, turrets, autoturrets, razor wires etc., great heavy weapons
6. good music and suitable weapon sounds
7. campaign is long enough

I DON'T LIKE:
1. horde mode is not good enough, only one map in there.
2. player skins, which you can buy, often are not really a change to an original skin

I changed my mind and I appreciate a great game overall, I recommend 100%, but still I would love it more if it had a map editor and skin editor perhaps.

So I have been playing near constantly whenever I have the time to play this game and that has been roughly 2.5 to 3 hours everyday since i bought the game. 
At this point I personally feel like the classes don't play different enough, apart from the medic but that can be said for many games. Game play is super fun but after playing through the entire catalog of missions three times each I feel like there is not enough content in this game. the missions themselves are really well designed especially the rome levels.
Graphics are really good as well along with performance has been super solid on my system (Ryzen 5 3600 GTX 1660S) has been great on high settings (as it was the default on).
but back at the level design while great it's static there is no new changes that occur and the modifiers while good aren't enough personally for me. Rough-like levels and objectives in missions would make this amazing.  
Customization is something I was very disappointed, no way to select attachments for your guns along with there being so few to chose from because each gun only has 5 levels respectively, almost all of them are unlocked on my end. Bare-bones character customization.
FINAL THOUGHTS:
-Game is fun for a while (make sure to play with friends to extend the life of the game on your end)
-Customization is okay but compared to other games like Deep Rock Galactic it pales really it does

Goodbye Epic, hello WWZ on Steam. Gladly, i was able to transfer all my previous progress to the Steam version.

World War Z supports cross-play across multiple platforms. It's possible to play together with your friends on Playstation 4/5, XBox One/Xbox Series X and Series S and Steam/EpicGames/Windows Store.
You will never have any issues finding other Players in this Game.

For Zombiegame lovers this Game is a must have in my Opinion.
You ever wanted to see hundreds of Zombies running to you on your Screen? Play WWZ and experience it by yourself. Besides the Common Infected, you get a bunch of "Special Zombies types" each with their own unique Ability trying to take you down! some of them eat more Bullets, so be sure you got enough Ammo ;)

This Game is fully co-op focused, so don't expect a versus Mode like there is in left4dead. There is a PvP Mode, but its not good at all.

- Graphics are nice, maps have pretty good layouts, nice looking characters to choose from.
- There is enough ammo, but plenty of opportunity for melee and environmental kills.
- Skill trees are decent.
- Story mode has enough difference between each group to keep things interesting. (Granted, the end goal is always just to survive, but they encounter different obstacles)
- Goals and "go here" markers are used appropriately. I did note a time or two when they could've been more obvious, but, if I ran into that issue, I didn't really have to wander far to find out where to go. 

My only nitpick is that you can only choose from a few prefab appearances for your player. I wish they would've allowed you to pick from various pieces of clothing and gear so you could make a truly unique look. It's not super important, just a preference.

FINAL SCORE: 9/10

bizarre. it feels like you're playing airsoft when shooting the ineffectual guns world war z aftermath, and i mean this as horribly as i can stress: these guns feel like nothing. no impact. no feeling. the sound is off--most guns dump their loads like they're afraid of someone walking in. the handling is off--there's virtually no kickback. the animation is off--there's virtually no motion. you pick up a shotgun and it shoots like a pistol. you pick up an assault rifle and it shoots like a shotgun. you pick up a heavy shotgun and it shoots like a shotgun shoots like an assault rifle shoots like a pistol shoots like every fucking worthlessly designed weapon placed into the hands of one of fourteen or twenty or however many of these strange soulless player designs. except the worn out asian mom with the sweater. she's cool looking. the rest look like they came out of a chuck e cheese arcade booth. you'd have a lot more fun with those arcade booths than you would with world war z, too--promise. in fact, i bought this game on sale for $19.99. do you know how many tickets that would get you at the house of mouse? all i'm saying is i know what i'm doing with MY steam refund.

Okay for what it is, which is a mostly on-rails third-person shooter. Looks nice, and it's very satisfying to mow down hundreds and hundreds of zombies.

Gameplay is static. There is a formula / pattern that is repeated for each episode, although the details are different. You know exactly what's going to happen after you've played them once. 

I only play single player. There is also co-op multiplayer so YMMV if you're into that.

A fun game for zombie games fan.
Pros: - Big arsenal for a zombie title, with a lot of variants of the same gun.
         - Very good scale. When they say "swarm", they actually meant it. Exactly like from the movie if you watched it before playing the game.


Cons: - Dumb AI. Like really dumb, and this is from someone who played Left 4 Dead with bots. At least in Left 4 Dead you can add mods for them.
          - Gameplay can get boring after a while, it's just "go grab this", "protect that", etc. But hey, this can also be said for a lot of other zombie games.

-> Is this game good? Yeah. It's a blast of a good time. Will it worth your money? Yeah-ish. Buy it when it's on sale is recommended.

It's everything I wish Back 4 Blood would have been. But it is awesome with its game play, none of that card nonsense as in B4B. The skill progression feels more like a good version of Battlefield or COD. Less specific weapon customization but predefined configurations, which I'm fine with. The difficulty levels are challenging to absurd, which is awesome. Graphics are great, and I kind of like that the "Specials" are something more realistic than heavily mutated creatures. The AI companions are actually useful.

Pure Garbage.

5/10
- Terrible A.I
     You got knocked down/catched? Good. Because it's A.I tactical moonwalk time.
     A.I pathing is terrible. It has tendency to follow your previous path even though you already move somewhere else. It also love to move in front of you when you're shooting.
     A.I Bots uses basic non upgraded weapon. Combine with A.I pathing, this can be a nightmare sometime.
- Zeke with leg can follow player like a flying ghost, made me doubt if it a normal walking zombie.
- Need option to join on-going match only.
- Some class need update.
- Weapons need rebalance. A big sniper rifle that feel weak unless you got the special version, burst-fire weapons aren't impressive and nobody using it in online pve, new "special smg" so "special" it really need buff,...
- Need more pve map, both campaign and horde. Some campaign map so bad it got people quit lobby the moment it appear. New campaigns are just meh.
- Difficulty need update. In some map, playing with A.I can be a nightmare and too easy with human.
- Character voice line sometime feel out of touch with the atmosphere and need some rework. This is WWZ, not a bunch of edgy hot shot in Back 4 Blood.
- Barely enough content, get bored quick.
- Movement and press hold button system feel sluggish.

I hate to give this game a thumbs down as I did enjoy my 85 hours of playing it and I like the game in general, but one major thing has killed it for me.

    My save game is gone. Or should I say it's stored where it should be but the game won't recognize it's there now even after attempting to fix it through multiple video tutorials. So I basically wasted 85 hours to get most weapons maxed, a few classes maxed, and make it to somewhere around level 200 just for the game to tell me I have to start back at level one now. I wouldn't mind it so much if the game had more replay value than it did, but sadly the maps and characters have gotten stale for me after the 80 hour mark...

    If you're willing to take the risk of your game being reset back to level one out of nowhere and not being able to fix it I would recommend this game as it's fun to jump into for some zombie slaying!

As I do normally, I started off checking the options. When I saw the "User Data and Privacy Collection - ON" I switched that OFF immediately. What did I get in response? If I turn off their ability to collect User Data, I am no longer allowed to play online. So I'm stuck playing the game with their handicapped AI companions. Freaking wonderful. So if you want to be able to play the game as it was intended, you are forced to allow them to collect user data. I'm sorry, but this is absolute BS. I am purchasing a game from you, I'm not getting married to you. Stop demanding I give you my data in order to use the products I purchased. It is to a point that these companies need to allow us to collect their data if they can collect ours. Maybe then they will keep to themselves and we can have a nice and orderly transaction.

1. Server sucks as fuck
I think WWZ server should be one of the worst server I have ever seen in my life. Even I host a peer-to-peer server, it can still go up to 50 - 60 ms for my friends and I. Shouldn't it be LAN ping at least for solo game?

2. Friendly AI is awfully bad
I swear the AI in this game is SO FUCKING TERRIBLE, AI can fuck you up in any way that you could never imagine. I enabled "I feel your pain" mod to make AI invincible but still, they can fuck you up hard. 
When you get downed by zombie (of course you do, because you are taking all the damage, even AI's), AI find it hard to save you because only 1 AI tries to save you at the time (other 2 would stand and stare at you. FUCK). AI generally takes 2 seconds to figure out what's going on and what to do, it's fucking retarded.

3. Defense system does not have flexibility
Random defense kit is fine but why I must put it at certain place where I would never think it is a good place to have a defense item. I just want to put it somewhere else.

4. Zombies are so agile while human is heavy as dumb
First of all, I am not a WWZ fan so it might be a WWZ feature, but why can a zombie sprint, slide or dodge a gunshot while player can do nothing other than run? Player is also forbidden to do anything when falling down from higher place too.

5. Zombie can attack you through distance
I am not sure if this is caused by terrible server or not, but I see many times zombie hurts me from a short distance that it shouldn't be able to hit. I guess it's just awful server.

6. FPS mode is not really FPS
Though the game provides FPS mode, it is actually not really FPS. I've seen many times that I can 100% land my shot on a zombie but shot it on a wall or an obstacle. REALLY? I even have my muzzle outside the obstacle.

If you want to play zombie shooter game casually, sure go ahead, but if you ever think of playing seriously. HELL THE FUCKING NO. I'm serious. For you own good.

First of all, no...it is not L4D; it simply is not as smooth or polished. Having said that, it is a worthy spiritual successor. Very much the same feel, with even a little character development and customization thrown in. WWZA has notable gun play, fantastic perk system/leveling, 8 solid classes that mesh strengths and weaknesses in a team dynamic; switchable TPS/FPS; enemies that can be absolutely ruthless and swarms that are like nothing you've played (see the movie); a little tower defense for fun; and if you're a glutton for punishment the higher difficulties will not disappoint you. One thing on my personal improvement wish list would be more visceral melee hits...otherwise melee combat is serviceable. Have had no issues in finding lobbies and other players for co-op. Just make sure you have multi-plat toggled...as long as you don't mind playing with the peasants. WWZA a solid 7 of 10.

The game does not make you free to choose the chapter of the challenges you want, but rather forces you to a different chapter on a daily basis,, also the development of characters becomes slow even if you finish the game, which makes you play for long periods without getting a great result.I also have an objection to the existence of Israel as a state that violates human rights, kills civilians, and presents it as a civilized state

You know how in L4D2 it tells you how many zombies total at the end of a 4 level campaign and the number is usually like 750 or a bit more?
This game doesn't do that, but it does show you how many zombies each player killed after [b]one[/b] of the levels (in a campaign with 3-4 levels).
 [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2611415991]Lemme do some basic math on a level i was just playing...[/url]  aaaand that adds up to [b]1781[/b] total.

If your looking for a new game to scratch that Left4Dead itch that Back4Blood was trying to replace, try this game. 

(Also I recommend you play on hard difficulty. If that's too hard for you then go down one but try not to go too easy or you wont experience the overwhelming hordes in as fun of a way)

I'm not sure what to give this game. I really enjoy the game overall, it's definitely like l4d on steroids as the hordes can get gigantic. However, unlike l4d the game will probably not survive. I'm hoping the dev team continues to develop and push content for this game, but if they're unwilling - add a workshop and allow modders to do it instead. It's a great game and I wouldn't want to see the potential rot away because nothing is being pushed for it.

Edit: Just to clarify as well: I know live service games have altered our way of viewing games - as if they need constant updates. I agree they don't. I'm just not sure if they'll release another game, would be cool if they did, but if not modding would help keep the game "new" for those of us who play the campaign or horde over and over again. For new players, however, know that the game is pretty fun as is too.
Very recommended zombie game.

This may be my favorite out of all of the 4-man co-op style games.  It's got some really good competition of late though.  I like the perk system and the way it kind of promotes experimenting with different builds essentially.  you can really get pretty creative with this game, in regards to play styles up until you get into the very topmost difficulties. 

 The difficulties, by the way, are scaled so perfectly in my opinion.  As soon as you're proficient, MOVE UP!  the zombies employ different tactics and teach you to be more effective if you pay attention.   This is a really well-crafted game that got unfairly overlooked.   I think it's movie tie-in circumstance probably affected this game negatively because it's one of the exceptions. 

 there can be frustrations in regards to adding friends sometimes from meeting in game, if you're on crossed platforms, so to speak.  I've met people in this game that it really hurt me to lose because there wasn't any efficient way of contacting them again after you're disconnected or w/e.  That may change or may have already. 

 I'm writing this after far more than only 54 hours or whatever it says.  I bought this game a second time on steam, thinking that i would bump into a larger playerbase than i typically saw on epic but it wasn't the case.  i really love this game and i still play it from time to time, but it really suffers from stale content.   

I played the slasher class almost all the time, until i started playing in the final difficulty extreme or whatever it is.  the slasher is kind of  set up for failure in many ways, no matter what difficulty, but there's a couple really effective perk combinations for this guy that can make it almost unstoppable until you get on extreme.    sadly, the slasher's prestige perks are all 100% useless and it's a total waste of money and time to grind them all out.  the only good perk you get out of prestige as slasher is hitting 1 more enemy before you become fatigued.   everything else is so negligible that you can only perceive them statistically.  i did it on epic games, but i just decided to keep the imaginary money on the steam version.

I'm a big fan of Killing Floor 2, Left 4 Dead series, and other first person shooters.  This is a good co-op game with smooth gameplay, challenging maps, crisp weapons, character leveling, and different play styles.  I am having a lot of fun.  You definitely need to play well and play with other people to beat the game on the hardest difficulties which makes it even more fun. Or you can play the easy mods to play through everything.  I like playing in third person view but you can also play first person view.  The game is pretty fair but you can be doing well and then your whole team gets wiped out unexpectedly and start over again, so you have to be careful.   I play with a Ryzen 2700 and a Vega 64 gpu on ultra settings and sometimes an older R9 290x gpu on high settings and both setups play very smooth with this game. Go team RED.

hate to say it, but this "expansion" was a waste of money and time. i was expecting more additions to the campaign, but all that was added was a handful of neat weapons and 1 or 2 added campaign episodes. theres hardly any players in the multiplayer, and even less so in open co-op's, just play L4D2 its better and has way more people.
Basically the best parts of Killing Floor 2 meets the worst parts of Aliens: Fireteam Elite. The bad outweighs the good here, unfortunately.

August 2022 edit: Game is developmentally dead. It has a bunch of campaigns which are about 3-4 missions long each, a single Horde survival map, and pvp multiplayer. Multiplayer is absolutely dead, but you can still find people to play with in the campaigns and horde mode relatively easily, as the game is crossplay with Steam, Epic, PS and Xbox. Pick it up on sale, it's a fun time, you'll probably get around 80 hrs of replayability before you never want to look at it again, though. I think the amount of campaigns the game has is fine, but it absolutely needs more horde maps.

***
 
Unironically one of the best co-op zombie games in recent years. Do yourself a favor and pick it up.

However, there's lots of cheaters. Being primarily co-op, it's not *that* big of a deal but it's still annoying as there's so many lv 999's that are inexcusably garbage players because they're boosted through cheats. I've yet to see a legitimate high level player, aside from a single 800-something who was beasting his way through an Insane-difficulty level on his own.

The cheaters vary from doing nothing out of the ordinary, to increasingly obvious things such as quietly getting their health back, respawning themselves after death, to teleporting out of bounds and aimbotting all the zombies on the map. With the game running on a peer-to-peer matchmaking system, the character files are easily editable and there's no way to report anyone so it's something you just have to either deal with or find a new lobby. It's a prevalent issue, but by-and-large, because of the nature of the game, not one that impacts your game experience 98% of the time. If you've played it, It's comparable to the cheaters in Payday 2 -- a lot of users and a few abusers.

Cheaters aside, the game honestly gets an 8/10 from me, as a longtime-fan of the 4 player co-op genre.

Get it on sale. Good game but it's been out for almost a year and they haven't fixed the special zombies. Bulls will charge you in a straight line and then a do 180 around a box to grab because that's realistic. Lurkers spawn around ANY corner and sometimes don't make noise. Love clearing a room just to get fucked by one that spawned behind. Rats aren't as bad but are buggy and hard to kill in certain terrains. Spitters are probably the only ones that weren't made by an autistic hamster. Bombers are okay but tank shots to their explosive vests sometimes for no reason. Screamers spawn out of sight and in the most out of the way spots just to make you run all the way around to get them in your line of sight.  Instead of fixing the zombies they clearly fucked up they decided to do a 30+ gb download to fix the horde mode. Overall the game is good but until they fix something as simple as fucked up special zombies then I would wait to get it on sale. Not worth full price for how much frustration you'll get out of it. Also, AI bots go full retard like 90% of the time if you don't have a full squad. At least they risk their lives just to revive you though.

This game is fun and is a lot like old classics like Left 4 Dead. Been playing this one with the wife since we love playing zombie games together and it's been entertaining with some exciting and rush moments. It's not scary or suspenseful at all (some friends saw that I was playing and thought to ask) but rather fast paced and frantic survival feel more so than anything else.
Won't really go into the nitty gritty since I am sure more hardcore passionate players will probably have already covered this or will cover it in better detail than myself but if you can get this game on sale you can put a solid 25-50 (or more if you plan on being a completionist) hours into it easy and it'll be fun for the most part. Don't forget to grab some friends, family or a significant other to play with as it makes this experience more worthwhile as certain rando's (as they usually are) are not reliable or just terrible to play with ie. was exploring the nooks and cranny's with the wife and one rando shot at us because he didn't like that we were taking too long so we booted him. There's one in every game or street corner somewhere...
10/10 recommend for some semi-brainless co-op fun.

there are 7 maps, each map is a destination,  New York, Moscow, Rome, Tokyo, Kamchatka, Marseille.....there are about 3 to 4 acts per map to complete.  Sounds like a lot doesn't it?

See how much time I have in this game? 11 hours when I typed this review.   I've burned through all of those maps and maxed out the Gunner class already and I just bought the game 2 days ago.   

There are difficulty levels,  Easy, Hard, Insane,  it's difficult to find other players on anything lower than hard difficulty and the game is actually not any fun at Easy because it's too easy.   

I've had fun with this game but in my opinion,  it's not finished,  there is about 1/10th of a Zombie game here and it's not much to brag about and it's not worth more than 5 to 10 bucks as it is even though the third person gun play is fun,  the zombie killing is fun, there's plenty of gadgets and explosives, it's still just not enough, the game is too short and it's too shallow, it's unfinished in my opinion.  The content that is there is polished enough for what the game is but there is still not enough missions at each location,  there should be at least 6 to 12 missions per location,  AT LEAST THAT MANY,  but there isn't so you will knock it all out in less than 10 hours of gameplay which will take about 2 to 3 days.     I do not recommend this game even though I like it because I feel that the developer screwed the consumer and overcharged for what they have to offer here.   It's a damn short game,  the shortest game I have ever played and once you finish all of those missions it just becomes ridiculously repetitive no matter how difficult it is.  Horde mode is moronic.  You can't even find weapons to switch to or medkits or ammo,  you buy defenses one at a time while a 1 minute timer ticks down and then the hordes are unleashed on you.

To think that this game used to cost over 40 bucks is disgusting,  it takes 10 hours to figure out that it's a scam.   This is not a triple A in depth, detailed, quality title well worth the asking price and even at the discount it's being offered for on the STEAM summer sale you will not get your money's worth even at 15 bucks.

Like I said there is quality but there isn't much of a game here.   There is a game, it's well made but there isn't much of it and it appears intentional.

This game lacks so much content that it almost could be mistaken for a DEMO.

It actually has a cool sort of Division 2 vibe meets Zombie Army thing going on there and it could have been exploited with more content but the developer chose a quick buck over value.

Dodge roll,  you can't dodge roll either.  But movement is actually just as smooth as in Division 2.  No dodge roll though.

What I'm wondering while I played this game is what about Berlin? Los Angeles? Chicgo? San Francisco?  Washington D.C. ? London?    each with at least a dozen missions.  No sir,  you get 7 other cities, only one in America and no more than 3 to 4 missions on average per city.  You can do 4 missions in one city in a few hours.  Some less than 2.

It's not the type of game that wears you out, where you play it for hours enjoying the vast amount of cool content, you will wear it out because you will run out of content and have to keep repeating what is there, over and over again.  What they offer instead of more missions and destination is more classes to level up with corresponding skills, variations on those skills, with weapons and new skins for those weapons, to unlock ACCESS to in game, during a mission. .....ridiculous, I know.  There should be at least a dozen locations with at least a dozen missions each for a total of 144 missions.  Each mission should take 30 minutes to an hour to finish.

I've got ELEVEN HOURS in this game and I've seen every mission and location that it has to offer and I'm done.  There are no more surprises here.

this is a 50 gigabyte game that you can finish in 10 hours.

Another point I'd like to make,  the players aren't given a fighting chance on levels above insane,  if you pick this difficulty level you will die quickly and none of you will finish the mission because the game is designed for you to fail.
